headline: He Walked Away From A $300K Finance Salary To Start A Business. Losing $200 Sushi And Ski Trips Every Winter Was 'Absolutely Brutal'
summary: After seven years in a high-paying finance role that looked perfect on paper but made him miserable, a 30-year-old finally quit. The job paid $300,000 a year, and came with a lifestyle full of fine dining, skiing, and status. But deep down, he hated it. From Paychecks To Pressure “No dramatic blow up, no big revelation,” he wrote in a recent Reddit post on r/Entrepreneur. “Just the quiet realization that I could not keep pretending I enjoyed it.” So he left.
